title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Overview > Description > RAK3212 Breakout Board Overview
content: The **RAK3212** is a breakout board featuring the RAK3112 module, which combines the Espressif ESP32-S3 MCU with a Semtech SX1262 LoRa transceiver. This low-power, long-range module supports LoRaWAN, BLE, and WiFi, making it ideal for a wide range of IoT applications such as home automation, sensor networks, building automation.
parent_content: The **RAK3212** is a breakout board featuring the RAK3112 module, which combines the Espressif ESP32-S3 MCU with a Semtech SX1262 LoRa transceiver. This low-power, long-range module supports LoRaWAN, BLE, and WiFi, making it ideal for a wide range of IoT applications such as home automation, sensor networks, building automation.

title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Internal Connections Between ESP32-S3 MCU and SX1262 LoRa transceiver > RAK3212 Breakout Board Pin Mapping [TABLE]
content:
| SX1262   | ESP32-S3 | Function               |
|----------|----------|------------------------|
| SPI_NSS  | GPIO7    | SPI select             |
| SPI_SCK  | GPIO5    | SPI clock              |
| SPI_MISO | GPIO3    | SPI Master in          |
| SPI_MOSI | GPIO6    | SPI Master out         |
| NRESET   | GPIO8    | SX1262 reset           |
| ANT_SW   | GPIO4    | SX1262 RF switch power |
| DIO1     | GPIO47   | SX1262 DIO1            |
| BUSY     | GPIO48   | SX1262 BUSY            |
parent_content:
| SX1262   | ESP32-S3 | Function               |
|----------|----------|------------------------|
| SPI_NSS  | GPIO7    | SPI select             |
| SPI_SCK  | GPIO5    | SPI clock              |
| SPI_MISO | GPIO3    | SPI Master in          |
| SPI_MOSI | GPIO6    | SPI Master out         |
| NRESET   | GPIO8    | SX1262 reset           |
| ANT_SW   | GPIO4    | SX1262 RF switch power |
| DIO1     | GPIO47   | SX1262 DIO1            |
| BUSY     | GPIO48   | SX1262 BUSY            |

title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Interfaces > Interfaces [TABLE]
content:
| Interfaces                                 |
|--------------------------------------------|
| USB (Default for AT command and FW update) |
| 2 x I2C                                    |
| 1 x UART                                   |
| 1 x SPI                                    |
parent_content:
| Interfaces                                 |
|--------------------------------------------|
| USB (Default for AT command and FW update) |
| 2 x I2C                                    |
| 1 x UART                                   |
| 1 x SPI                                    |

title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK3212-Breakout-Board GPIO Pin Availability [TABLE]
content:
> **INFO:** - GPIO33 to GPIO37 are on the stamp module’s pins, but with the 16MB Flash chip, these GPIOs are not available.
- GPIO4 is used internally and not available.  
> **Image:** RAK3212 Pin Headers
parent_content:
> **INFO:** - GPIO33 to GPIO37 are on the stamp module’s pins, but with the 16MB Flash chip, these GPIOs are not available.
- GPIO4 is used internally and not available.  
> **Image:** RAK3212 Pin Headers

title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > Pin Definition > RAK3212 Pins > Pin Headers J3, J4, J5, J6 Pinout [TABLE]
content:
Pin Header J3  
| **Pin No.** | **Name**     | **Type** | **Description**       |
|-------------|--------------|----------|-----------------------|
| 1           | 5V           | Power    | 5V USB          |
| 2           | 5V           | Power    | 5V USB          |
| 3           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 4           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 5           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
parent_content:
Pin Header J3  
| **Pin No.** | **Name**     | **Type** | **Description**       |
|-------------|--------------|----------|-----------------------|
| 1           | 5V           | Power    | 5V USB          |
| 2           | 5V           | Power    | 5V USB          |
| 3           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 4           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 5           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 6           | GPIO0 / Boot | I/O Boot | GPIO Bootloader force |
| 7           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 8           | VCC          | Power    | 3.3V Supply     |
| 9           | VCC          | Power    | 3.3V Supply     |  
Pin Header J4  
| **Pin No.** | **Name**       | **Type**       | **Description** |
|-------------|----------------|----------------|-----------------|
| 1           | GPIO18/I2C SCL | I2C Clock      | I2C 2 SCL       |
| 2           | GPIO21/AIN0    | GPIO/Analog In | GPIO            |
| 3           | GPIO38         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 4           | GPIO39         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 5           | GPIO40/I2C SCL | GPIO/I2C Clock | I2C 1 SCL       |
| 6           | GPIO41         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 7           | GPIO42         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 8           | GPIO45         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 9           | GPIO46         | GPIO           | GPIO            |  
Pin Header J5  
| **Pin No.** | **Name**        | **Type**       | **Description** |
|-------------|-----------------|----------------|-----------------|
| 1           | GPIO1           | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 2           | GPIO2           | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 3           | GPIO9/I2C SDA   | GPIO/I2C Data  | I2C 1 SDA       |
| 4           | GPIO10/SPI MISO | GPIO/SPI MISO  | SPI MISO        |
| 5           | GPIO11/SPI MOSI | GPIO/SPI MOSI  | SPI MOSI        |
| 6           | GPIO12/SPI CS   | GPIO/SPI CS    | SPI CS          |
| 7           | GPIO13/SPI SCK  | GPIO/SPI SCK   | SPI SCK         |
| 8           | GPIO14/AIN1     | GPIO/Analog In | GPIO            |
| 9           | GPIO17/I2C SDA  | GPIO/I2C Data  | I2C 2 SDA       |  
Pin Header J6  
| **Pin No.** | **Name** | **Type**      | **Description**           |
|-------------|----------|---------------|---------------------------|
| 1           | GPIO33   | GPIO          | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 2           | GPIO34   | GPIO          | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 3           | GPIO35   | GPIO/I2C Data | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 4           | GPIO36   | GPIO/SPI MISO | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 5           | GPIO37   | GPIO/SPI MOSI | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 6           | GPIO4    | NC            | N/A                       |
| 7           | UART0_RX | GPIO/UART     | UART 0 RX                 |
| 8           | UART0_TX | GPIO/UART     | UART 0 TX                 |
| 9           | GND      | Power         | GND                       |

| 5           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 6           | GPIO0 / Boot | I/O Boot | GPIO Bootloader force |
| 7           | GND          | Power    | GND                   |
| 8           | VCC          | Power    | 3.3V Supply     |
| 9           | VCC          | Power    | 3.3V Supply     |  
Pin Header J4  
| **Pin No.** | **Name**       | **Type**       | **Description** |
|-------------|----------------|----------------|-----------------|
| 1           | GPIO18/I2C SCL | I2C Clock      | I2C 2 SCL       |
| 2           | GPIO21/AIN0    | GPIO/Analog In | GPIO            |
| 3           | GPIO38         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 4           | GPIO39         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 5           | GPIO40/I2C SCL | GPIO/I2C Clock | I2C 1 SCL       |
| 6           | GPIO41         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 7           | GPIO42         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 8           | GPIO45         | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 9           | GPIO46         | GPIO           | GPIO            |  
Pin Header J5  
| **Pin No.** | **Name**        | **Type**       | **Description** |
|-------------|-----------------|----------------|-----------------|
| 1           | GPIO1           | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 2           | GPIO2           | GPIO           | GPIO            |
| 3           | GPIO9/I2C SDA   | GPIO/I2C Data  | I2C 1 SDA       |
| 4           | GPIO10/SPI MISO | GPIO/SPI MISO  | SPI MISO        |
| 5           | GPIO11/SPI MOSI | GPIO/SPI MOSI  | SPI MOSI        |
| 6           | GPIO12/SPI CS   | GPIO/SPI CS    | SPI CS          |
| 7           | GPIO13/SPI SCK  | GPIO/SPI SCK   | SPI SCK         |
| 8           | GPIO14/AIN1     | GPIO/Analog In | GPIO            |
| 9           | GPIO17/I2C SDA  | GPIO/I2C Data  | I2C 2 SDA       |  
Pin Header J6  
| **Pin No.** | **Name** | **Type**      | **Description**           |
|-------------|----------|---------------|---------------------------|
| 1           | GPIO33   | GPIO          | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 2           | GPIO34   | GPIO          | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 3           | GPIO35   | GPIO/I2C Data | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 4           | GPIO36   | GPIO/SPI MISO | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 5           | GPIO37   | GPIO/SPI MOSI | N/A with 16MB PSRAM |
| 6           | GPIO4    | NC            | N/A                       |
| 7           | UART0_RX | GPIO/UART     | UART 0 RX                 |
| 8           | UART0_TX | GPIO/UART     | UART 0 TX                 |
| 9           | GND      | Power         | GND                       |

title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > LoRa Transceiver > RAK3112 Module Supported LoRaWAN Bands [TABLE]
content:
The RAK3112 module supports many LoRaWAN bands as shown in the table below.  
| Module | Region | Frequency |
| --- | --- | --- |
| RAK3112 (H) | Europe | EU868 |
| RAK3112 (H) | North America | US915 |
| RAK3112 (H) | Australia | AU915 |
| RAK3112 (H) | Korea | KR920 |
| RAK3112 (H) | Asia | AS923-1/2/3/4 |
| RAK3112 (H) | India | IN865 |
| RAK3112 (H) | Russia | RU864 |

title: RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > WiFi > TX Power > Transmit Power Rates for Different Wi-Fi Standards [TABLE]

RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Hardware > RF Characteristics > WiFi > RX Sensitivity > RAK3212-Breakout-Board Wi-Fi Receiver Sensitivity [TABLE]

RAK3212 LoRaWAN Breakout Board with BLE & WiFi Datasheet | Specs & Features > RAK3212 WisDuo LoRaWAN + BLE + WiFi Breakout Board Datasheet > Specifications > Firmware > Developing Firmware for RAK3212 Breakout Board
content: The RAK3212 does not include pre-installed firmware. To use the module, you must develop your own application with the Arduino IDE and the Espressif BSP.
parent_content: The RAK3212 does not include pre-installed firmware. To use the module, you must develop your own application with the Arduino IDE and the Espressif BSP. Example projects for LoRa, LoRaWAN, BLE, and WiFi are available in our GitHub repository. Additionally, a guide for firmware development can be found in the [RAK3112 Quick Start Guide.](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3112-module/quickstart/#software-setup)

parent_content: The RAK3212 does not include pre-installed firmware. To use the module, you must develop your own application with the Arduino IDE and the Espressif BSP. Example projects for LoRa, LoRaWAN, BLE, and WiFi are available in our GitHub repository. Additionally, a guide for firmware development can be found in the [RAK3112 Quick Start Guide.](https://docs.rakwireless.com/product-categories/wisduo/rak3112-module/quickstart/#software-setup)
